algorithm_technique: Iterate from the end of the array, tracking collected elements using a hash set/boolean array.
problem_summary_simple: Collect elements 1 to k by removing from the end of an array.
problem_summary_technical: Uses a boolean array to track collected elements from the end of `nums`, stopping when 1 to k are found.
key_insights: Processing the array in reverse is crucial because operations remove elements from the end.
A boolean array (or hash set) efficiently tracks which numbers from 1 to k have been collected.
The minimum operations are determined by the index of the last element needed to complete the collection.
